messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (17:30): Hmm, I thought it was required that a charset-declaring <meta> was the first element in the <head>, but it doesn't seem to be
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:32): It might have used to be
a5218d2a72481c137ed6383d3526a093 (17:43): i think it only needs to fit in the first 512 bytes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:46): smaug____, another difference is when INVALID_STATE_ERR exception is thrown
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:46): (See http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/semantics.html#charset512 )
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:46): (which is not at all a confusing link)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:47): smaug____, in Gecko it happens if the callback invokes detach(); in WebKit you have to invoke the method again
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (17:58): good morning, Whatwg!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:01): good afternoon, e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:13): As long as the implementor requirements are that you have to look for an encoding forever it is still not really nice though
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:13): That is, not fully deterministic
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:14): Or maybe that changed

c53ce266132145423a95034f111ad7dd (18:30): ‚ÄúIt's utterly bizarre to me that HTML5 would impose an "authoring requirement" which it doesn't bother to add to its implementation requirements, particularly when its failure to do so could result in a security vulnerability. But I don't work on much HTML5 stuff myself.‚Äù ‚Äî Eric Law http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2011/07/18/optimal-html-head-ordering-to-avoid-parser-restarts-red
c53ce266132145423a95034f111ad7dd (18:30): ownloads-and-improve-performance.aspx

c53ce266132145423a95034f111ad7dd (18:31): let‚Äôs try that again: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ieinternals/archive/2011/07/18/optimal-html-head-ordering-to-avoid-parser-restarts-redownloads-and-improve-performance.aspx
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:33): he doesn't explain the vulnerability
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:36): It would be nice if he would
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:36): I was going to ask but got distracted by charset metas not having to be first in the head per spec
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:37): I am guessing it it just a "some people might have bad sanitizers" vunerability, but maybe I will be surprised
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:45): How would you describe (1 << (node.nodeType() - 1)) & iterator.whatToShow in prose?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:46): It is needed to map the constants of http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Traversal-Range/traversal.html#Traversal-NodeFilter to Node.XXX_Node constants
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:46): "If the n'th bit (where 0 is the least significant bit) of whatToShow is set, where n is nodeType"?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:47): (or nodeType-1)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:00): &lt edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e> yeah, but we first need to figure out the Web platform
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:09): you have quite the backlog
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:14): Any reason that the web dom core tests aren't on the W3C server? Or am I looking in the wrong place?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:15): they are in http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/webapps/

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:16): Oh, I thought they might be in the same place as the spec or something. Would make them easier to find
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (19:16): w3c-test.org is out-of-date again..

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (19:16): no idea why they moved
